title: Professional corporate theme polish (tokens + component styling)

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive, modern corporate theme across the site while preserving all existing sections and content structure.
acceptanceCriteria: The overall look and feel is consistently professional across header, all sections, and footer (no section appears to use a different style system).
Typography is consistent (heading hierarchy, body sizes, line-heights) and readability is improved compared to current theme.
Color usage is restrained and consistent (primary/secondary/accent are used intentionally; muted/foreground contrast meets accessibility expectations).
No content sections are removed or hidden as part of the theme upgrade.

file_operations.description: Refine global base styling to a more corporate look: adjust typographic rhythm (line-heights, paragraph defaults), default focus visibility, and consistent surface/background treatment. Use shadcn-ui token approach (CSS variables consumed by Tailwind) to keep styling cohesive; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the top-level layout applies consistent background and spacing conventions (e.g., main area surface/section separation) without changing routing or section composition; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Tune section background overlay/opacity and section spacing classes so the visual system matches other sections (more restrained, corporate contrast) while keeping content structure intact; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align testimonial card styling and section background to the unified theme (consistent surfaces, borders, and text contrast) without altering content; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update global theme tokens and shared utility classes to reduce one-off styling drift, preserving existing routing and features.
acceptanceCriteria: Global design tokens (background/foreground, primary/secondary/accent, border/ring, radii, shadows) are updated to reflect the new theme.
Common shared classes (e.g., navigation link styling, section spacing, section headings) reflect the new theme and reduce one-off styling drift.
The site renders correctly in both light and dark mode if dark mode is currently supported by tokens (no unreadable text on either mode).

file_operations.description: Update CSS variable tokens for a corporate palette (more neutral surfaces, restrained accent, improved contrast), refine radii/shadows, and enhance shared utility classes (e.g., nav-link, section-spacing, section-heading). Keep shadcn-ui source files untouched by relying on token-driven styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust Tailwind theme extensions to match updated tokens (e.g., shadows, radii, typography defaults) and ensure token usage stays consistent across light/dark modes; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a small shared SectionHeader component to standardize section title/subtitle spacing and typography (reducing drift) without changing content or adding new features. Use shadcn-ui/Tailwind conventions for consistent tokens; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adopt the shared SectionHeader and shared theme utility classes to remove one-off typography/spacing differences while keeping the same content; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adopt the shared SectionHeader and shared theme utility classes for headings/spacing to align with the new global tokens; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adopt the shared SectionHeader and shared theme utility classes to standardize layout rhythm and improve visual consistency; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adopt the shared SectionHeader and shared theme utility classes to align contact section spacing and typographic hierarchy with the updated tokens; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adopt the shared SectionHeader for consistent heading/subtitle styling and spacing across sections; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Polish header/navigation, buttons, cards, and contact panels with consistent hover/focus states and premium visual rhythm.
acceptanceCriteria: Header and navigation look more polished (spacing, alignment, hover/active states) and remain fully functional on desktop and mobile.
Buttons have consistent sizing, typography, hover, and focus styles across the app.
Cards and panels have consistent borders/radii/shadows and consistent internal spacing across all sections.
No regressions in responsiveness: layout remains clean on mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints.

file_operations.description: Refine header layout density (container spacing, logo/title alignment), update desktop nav link styling to match the new corporate theme, and ensure consistent hover/focus/active states using shared utilities (without changing behavior). Do not modify shadcn ui sources; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Polish mobile navigation surfaces, active state, and tap targets for a premium look while keeping functionality unchanged; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align footer typography, link styling, and borders/shadows with the new theme tokens; ensure consistent spacing and readability across breakpoints; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Normalize hero button variants and spacing so primary/secondary/outline styles look consistent and professional; keep the same calls-to-action and scroll behavior; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Standardize service cards (border, radius, shadow, hover/focus) to match a premium corporate card style while keeping content unchanged; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Standardize project cards/panels (surface translucency, border/shadow, internal spacing) and ensure consistent hover behavior; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Unify About/Leadership card styling (surface, border, shadow, spacing) with the global card system and ensure consistent hover/focus states; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Unify Why Choose Us feature cards with the same card/panel styling system (consistent radius/shadow/border and spacing); verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Polish the contact information panel and note panel styling (surface, border, icon containers) for a more corporate look; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align form panel styling with the card/panel system and ensure consistent focus/invalid states and button sizing across variants (without changing validation/submission behavior); verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
